trans-unit.source: Manage Role Based Access Control (RBAC) with Azure PowerShell | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to manage RBAC with Azure PowerShell including listing roles, assigning roles and deleting role assignments.
trans-unit.target: How to manage RBAC with Azure PowerShell including listing roles, assigning roles and deleting role assignments.

trans-unit.source: Create custom role
trans-unit.target: Create custom role

trans-unit.source: To create a custom role, use the `New-AzureRmRoleDefinition` command.
trans-unit.target: To create a custom role, use the `New-AzureRmRoleDefinition` command.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a custom role called *Virtual Machine Operator* that grants access to all read operations of *Microsoft.Compute*, *Microsoft.Storage*, and *Microsoft.Network* resource providers, and grants access to start, restart, and monitor virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a custom role called *Virtual Machine Operator* that grants access to all read operations of *Microsoft.Compute*, *Microsoft.Storage*, and *Microsoft.Network* resource providers, and grants access to start, restart, and monitor virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: The custom role can be used in two subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: The custom role can be used in two subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Modify a custom role
trans-unit.target: Modify a custom role

trans-unit.source: To modify a custom role first, use the `Get-AzureRmRoleDefinition` command to retrieve role definition.
trans-unit.target: To modify a custom role first, use the `Get-AzureRmRoleDefinition` command to retrieve role definition.

trans-unit.source: Then, make desired changes to the role definition.
trans-unit.target: Then, make desired changes to the role definition.

trans-unit.source: Finally, use `Set-AzureRmRoleDefinition` command to save the modified role definition.
trans-unit.target: Finally, use `Set-AzureRmRoleDefinition` command to save the modified role definition.

trans-unit.source: The following example adds the `Microsoft.Insights/diagnosticSettings/*` operation to the *Virtual Machine Operator* custom role.
trans-unit.target: The following example adds the `Microsoft.Insights/diagnosticSettings/*` operation to the *Virtual Machine Operator* custom role.

trans-unit.source: The following example adds an Azure subscription to the assignable scopes of the Virtual Machine Operator custom role.
trans-unit.target: The following example adds an Azure subscription to the assignable scopes of the Virtual Machine Operator custom role.

trans-unit.source: Delete a custom role
trans-unit.target: Delete a custom role

trans-unit.source: To delete a custom role, use the `Remove-AzureRmRoleDefinition` command.
trans-unit.target: To delete a custom role, use the `Remove-AzureRmRoleDefinition` command.

trans-unit.source: The following example removes the *Virtual Machine Operator* custom role.
trans-unit.target: The following example removes the *Virtual Machine Operator* custom role.

trans-unit.source: List custom roles
trans-unit.target: List custom roles

trans-unit.source: To list the roles that are available for assignment at a scope, use the `Get-AzureRmRoleDefinition` command.
trans-unit.target: To list the roles that are available for assignment at a scope, use the `Get-AzureRmRoleDefinition` command.

trans-unit.source: The following example lists all role available for assignment in the selected subscription.
trans-unit.target: The following example lists all role available for assignment in the selected subscription.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the *Virtual Machine Operator* custom role isn’t available in the *Production4* subscription because that subscription isn’t in the **AssignableScopes** of the role.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, the *Virtual Machine Operator* custom role isn’t available in the *Production4* subscription because that subscription isn’t in the **AssignableScopes** of the role.
